title: 106_hr4937
content: The Medicare Protection and Fairness Act of 2000 includes increases in payments for inpatient hospital services, home health services, and Medicare+Choice organizations. It eliminates reductions in payments and aims to improve healthcare funding. Subtitle A and B of the Medicare Protection and Fairness Act of 2000 focus on modifications to risk adjustment methodology and blended capitation rates for Medicare+Choice. Subtitle C addresses reporting requirements for Medicare health care services in military treatment facilities. The Medicare Protection and Fairness Act of 2000 includes an increase in payments for inpatient hospital services and disproportionate share hospitals in fiscal years 2001 and 2002. Section 1886(d)(5)(F)(ix) of the Social Security Act is amended to adjust payment reductions for fiscal years 2000, 2001, and 2002. Additionally, the reduction in payments for indirect costs of graduate medical education is eliminated. Section 1886(d)(5)(B) of the Social Security Act is amended to remove certain subclauses and make adjustments to payment periods. This is followed by a title addressing an increase in payments for home health services, specifically the elimination of a 15 percent reduction under the prospective payment system. The Social Security Act is amended to compute a standard prospective payment amount based on audited cost report data for a 12-month period. The system shall calculate payment amounts based on standardized data to account for variations in case mix and wage adjustments among home health agencies in a budget-neutral manner. The Secretary may consider regional or urbanized area differences. The amendment will take effect as part of the Medicare, Medicaid enactment. The amendment will take effect as part of the Medicare, Medicaid, and SCHIP Balanced Budget Refinement Act of 1999. TITLE III--INCREASE IN PAYMENTS TO MEDICARE+CHOICE ORGANIZATIONS, Subtitle A--Modifications to Risk Adjustment Methodology, SEC. 301. APPLICATION OF BUDGET NEUTRALITY PRINCIPLE TO THE NEW MEDICARE+CHOICE RISK ADJUSTMENT METHODOLOGY. SEC. 302. 10-YEAR PHASE-IN FOR RISK ADJUSTMENT. The methodology for risk adjustment under the Social Security Act shall be implemented in a budget-neutral manner, with no significant change in expenditures compared to previous methods. Effective upon enactment, this applies to payments starting in January 2001. SEC. 302 amends the risk adjustment methodology under the Social Security Act to phase in adjustments to capitation rates for health status over 10 years. SEC. 311 allows for the election of application in 2001 and 2002 of 50:50 area-specific and national percentages for the blended capitation rate. Section 1853(c)(2) of the Social Security Act is amended to allow Medicare+Choice organizations to elect to apply different subparagraphs for 2001 and 2002. Section 1853(c)(6)(B) is also amended to increase the national per capita Medicare+Choice growth percentage in 2001 and 2002. Subtitle C--Reporting Requirements for Medicare Health Care Services Furnished in Military Treatment Facilities. SEC. 321. REPORTING COSTS INCURRED UNDER MEDICARE SUBVENTION DEMONSTRATION PROJECT FOR MILITARY RETIREES. Subtitle C--Reporting Costs Incurred Under Medicare Subvention Demonstration Project for Military Retirees: Amends Section 1896 of the Social Security Act to require military treatment facilities to report costs incurred for providing Medicare health care services to eligible military retirees or dependents for the purpose of calculating Medicare+Choice payment rates. The amendment requires military treatment facilities to report capitation rates for Medicare+Choice payment areas to the Secretary by March 31 of the following year. The amendment applies to years starting from January 1, 2000.
